alert.note: Alert for Cherokee; Clay (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued January 09 at 12:04PM EST until January 10 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of southwest North Carolina, including the following counties, Cherokee and Clay. * WHEN...Until 7 PM EST this evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Heavy rainfall will continue for the next several hours with most places having reported 3 inches or more of rain. An already saturated ground will keep potential for flooding through the rest of the day. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
